stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains the photographer’s choice of composition and subject in image 2 ?

features.html:
Image 1

Gérald Bloncourt, French photographer, “Demonstration in Paris for Sécurité Sociale [the French national health and pensions organization], May 1980

© Gerald Bloncourt/Bridgeman Images

The banner reads: “Social Security in danger.” “The right and access to health for all is threatened.” Fight alongside the CGT.” The CGT was a confederation of French trade unions.

Image 2

Neil Libbert, British photographer, “DHSS [Department of Health and Social Security] Benefit Office, Tavistock Place,” London, 1987

Photo © Neil Libbert / Bridgeman Images

choicesHtml: He wished to show the benefits of Britain’s national health-care system to audiences that were increasingly critical of it.
He hoped to demonstrate the multiethnic character of Britain to audiences who were fearful of immigration from former colonies.
He wanted to show the despair and poor conditions of the people who relied on the welfare state.
He desired to support Thatcher’s Conservative government, which promised to cut welfare benefits.
